revision.text:
{{pp-vandalism|small=yes}} {{Infobox YouTube personality | name = Ryan Higa | image = Ryan Higa by Gage Skidmore.jpg | caption = Higa at [[VidCon]] in June 2012 | channels = {{flatlist| * [https://www.youtube.com/user/nigahiga nigahiga] * [https://www.youtube.com/user/HigaTV HigaTV]}} | views = 3.79 billion+ (nigahiga)
740 million+ (HigaTV) | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1990|06|06|mf=yes}} | birth_place = [[Hilo, Hawaii|Hilo]], [[Hawaii]], U.S. | nationality = American | residence = [[Las Vegas, Nevada|Las Vegas]], [[Nevada]], U.S. | occupation = Comedian, [[List of YouTubers|YouTuber]], actor | website = {{URL|www.higatv.com}} | years_active = 2006–present | genre = [[Comedy]] | subscribers = 21 million+ (nigahiga)
5 million+ (HigaTV) | network = | associated_acts = [[Wong Fu Productions]], [[Smosh]], [[Traphik]], [[Jenna Marbles]], [[D-trix]], [[David Choi]], [[Andrew Garcia]] | catchphrase(s) = TEEHEE | creator = {{unbulleted list|Ryan Higa|Sean Fujiyoshi|Tim Enos|Tarynn Nago}} | silver_year = 2007 (nigahiga)
2011 (HigaTV) | gold_year = 2009 (nigahiga)
2013 (HigaTV) | diamond_year = 2013 (nigahiga) | silver_button = yes | gold_button = yes | diamond_button = yes | stats_update = June 20, 2018 }} '''Ryan Higa''' (born June 6, 1990), also known by his [[YouTube]] username '''nigahiga''' ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|n|iː|ɡ|ə|h|iː|ɡ|ə}}), is an American comedian, [[List of YouTubers|YouTuber]], and actor. He is known for his comedy videos on YouTube, which have been viewed over 3 billion times. Higa's YouTube channel, nigahiga, was the [[List of most subscribed users on YouTube#Historical most subscribed channels|most subscribed channel on YouTube]] for 677 consecutive days from 2009–2011, longer than any other channel besides [[PewDiePie]]. {{As of|2018|6}}, he has over 21 million subscribers, making his channel the [[List of most-subscribed YouTube channels|36th most subscribed on YouTube]].{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/user/nigahiga/about|title=nigahiga|publisher=[[YouTube]]|accessdate=March 31, 2018}} == Early life == Higa is of [[Japanese Americans|Japanese descent]],{{cite web|last1=Considine|first1=Austin|title=For Asian-American Stars, Many Web Fans|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2011/07/31/fashion/for-asian-stars-many-web-fans.html|publisher=The New York Times|accessdate=April 30, 2015|date=July 29, 2011}} specifically from [[Okinawa Island|Okinawa]].{{cite web|last1=Higa|first1=Ryan|title=Tweet 21137901638|url=https://twitter.com/TheRealRyanHiga/status/21137901638|publisher=Twitter|accessdate=January 8, 2016|date=August 14, 2010}} He was born in [[Hilo, Hawaii|Hilo]], [[Hawaii]] on June 6, 1990,{{cite web|title=HIGAtv.com: About|url=http://www.higatv.com/about.php|publisher=HigaTv Productions|accessdate=December 29, 2011|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111226090853/http://www.higatv.com/about.php|archivedate=December 26, 2011|df=}} and has an older brother named Kyle.{{Citation|last=nigahiga|title=Life Hacks! (Dear Ryan)|date=2015-05-08|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a6E-dFOXgTg&feature=youtu.be|accessdate=2017-04-29}} Growing up, Higa competed in [[judo]] and holds a [[Rank in Judo|black belt rank]].{{cite web|last=Ko|first=Nalea J.|title=Ryan Higa Snatches No.1 Spot on YouTube|url=http://news.newamericamedia.org/news/view_article.html?article_id=35893fc0bb72f272e5fcb0c113c98c26|publisher=New America Media|accessdate=July 1, 2013|date=September 16, 2009}}{{cite web|title=HHSAA JUDO: 2007 HHSAA Judo State Championships|url=http://www.sportshigh.com/sports/judo/articles/2006-2007/0519_judo_finals|publisher=The Hawaii High School Athletic Association|accessdate=July 1, 2013|date=May 19, 2007}} He wrestled at [[Waiakea High School]], where he graduated in 2008.{{cite web|title=Ryan Higa|url=http://www.nndb.com/people/644/000354579/|publisher=[[NNDB]]|accessdate=October 18, 2012}}{{cite web|title=State Wrestling Results|url=http://the.honoluluadvertiser.com/article/2008/Mar/02/sp/hawaii803020371.html|publisher=Honolulu Advertiser|accessdate=July 1, 2013|date=March 2, 2008}} == YouTube career == Higa and Sean Fujiyoshi began posting YouTube videos of themselves [[lip sync]]ing to songs in mid-2006 while attending [[Waiakea High School]].{{cite news | title = Hilo teens become a Web video sensation. | url=http://the.honoluluadvertiser.com/article/2008/Jul/27/il/hawaii807270330.html | publisher = The Honolulu Advertiser | date = July 27, 2008 | accessdate = August 21, 2009}} They quickly expanded beyond songs, with a variety of other comedic pieces. Occasional guest appearances were made by Tim Enos, Ryan Villaruel, Kyle Chun, and Tarynn Nago.{{cite web|url=http://archives.starbulletin.com/2008/01/11/features/screentime.html |title=starbulletin.com | Features | /2008/01/11/ |publisher=Archives.starbulletin.com |date=January 11, 2008 |accessdate=July 13, 2010}} On Christmas Eve of 2008, Higa and Fujiyoshi's two most popular videos, ''How To Be Gangster'' and ''How To Be Emo'', were removed due to copyright violations.{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FCTAqdDfL58&feature=player_embedded|title=Copyrighted|last=Higa|first=Ryan|date=February 23, 2009|publisher=[[YouTube]]|accessdate=December 11, 2009}} On January 21, 2009, the nigahiga account was temporarily suspended and was required to remove more copyrighted videos. Because of this, nigahiga's lip syncing videos were all removed (with the exception of ''You're Beautiful'', which was audio swapped),{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PhlvZuwl_pc|title=You're Beautiful|last=Higa|first=Ryan|date=June 27, 2008|publisher=[[YouTube]]|accessdate=November 29, 2009}} along with most of his other videos that included copyrighted music. Since then, Higa started composing the music himself. ''How to be Gangster'' and ''How to be Emo'' were put back on nigahiga's channel in late August 2009, only to be removed a few days later, along with ''How to be Ninja'' and ''How to be Nerd''. In Spring 2010, ''How to be Ninja'', ''How to be Gangster'' and ''How to be Emo'' were made public once more.{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/user/nigahiga?blend=1&ob=4#g/u|title=Uploads|last=Higa|first=Ryan|publisher=[[YouTube]]|accessdate=October 21, 2012}} After Higa moved to [[Las Vegas Valley|Las Vegas]] to study [[nuclear medicine]]{{Cite web|title = Interview: Ryan Higa on his YouTube celebrity status|url=http://www.scmp.com/magazines/48hrs/article/1736835/interview-ryan-higa-his-youtube-celebrity-status|publisher=South China Morning Post|accessdate=December 7, 2015}} at the [[University of Nevada, Las Vegas]],{{cite web|url=http://www.westhawaiitoday.com/articles/2008/05/25/sports/local_sports/sports04.txt |title=from archives > hi1,500 |publisher=West Hawaii Today |date=May 25, 2008 |accessdate=July 13, 2010}} most of the nigahiga videos were solo efforts, usually featuring collaborations with other YouTube users. Since 2012, Higa has put together a production company, Ryan Higa Production Company (RHPC), which includes Sean Fujiyoshi, that works together to make content for the nigahiga channel. In 2016, Higa and other YouTubers and friends created the parody [[K-pop]] group [[Boys Generally Asian]]. == BgA == {{Main|Boys Generally Asian}} In 2016 Ryan Higa made a K-pop band with [[David Choi]], Phillip Wang, [[Jun Sung Ahn]] and [[Justin Chon]]. It was called BgA, standing for Boys Generally Asian. Their first song was called "Dong Saya Dae", which currently has over 13 million views on YouTube.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=beZFLT0Ixag In 2017, BgA released their second song "Who's It Gonna Be".https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gw6WIU5AF7k&t=263s == Channels == The nigahiga YouTube channel was created on July 20, 2006, by Higa, Fujiyoshi, Enos, and Nago (known collectively as "The Yabo Crew"). By December 21, 2010, it had reached 3 million subscribers, the first channel to do so.[http://www.hawaiisocialmedia.com/2010/12/nigahiga/ Ryan Higa Hits 3 Million YouTube Subscribers] According to Higa,{{cite web|last=Tko|first=Tonya|title=NigaHiga Explains Name, Happy Slip, Kev Jumba & TonyaTko -Amazing Asians vol 1.|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=blAWuc-3_08#t=01m29s|publisher=YouTube|accessdate=February 27, 2012|date=November 30, 2008}} his channel name is a combination of "Niga", which means "rant" in Japanese, and his last name, "Higa".{{cite web|last1=Lunn|first1=Emma|title=Jenna Marbles, Holasoygerman, Smosh and Nigahiga: The YouTube comedians earning millions|url=https://uk.finance.yahoo.com/news/the-youtube-comedians-earning-millions-153436484.html|publisher=Yahoo! UK & Ireland Finance|accessdate=April 30, 2015|date=December 1, 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150518092106/https://uk.finance.yahoo.com/news/the-youtube-comedians-earning-millions-153436484.html|archivedate=May 18, 2015|df=}} In 2011, he created a second channel, under the name HigaTV, where he posts video blogs and behind the scenes videos. As of June 2018, it has over 5 million subscribers.{{cite web|publisher=YouTube|url=https://www.youtube.com/user/higatv/about|title=HigaTV|accessdate=October 3, 2016}} In 2012, Higa helped form the [[YOMYOMF|YOMYOMF Network]], which hosts the online video-making talent competition, ''[[Internet Icon]]'', of which he served alongside [[Christine Lakin]] and [[Traphik|Timothy DeLaGhetto]] as main judges.{{cite web|author=Jeff Sneider|url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1118052020|title='Internet Icon' aims for virality|publisher=Variety|date=May 28, 2012|accessdate=December 10, 2012}} == Films == In 2008, Los Angeles producer [[Richard Van Vleet]] offered to help them create their first feature-length film. The resulting film, ''Ryan and Sean's Not So Excellent Adventure'', was directed by Richard Van Vleet and released on November 14, 2008.{{cite web|url=http://movies.zap2it.com/movies/ryan-and-seans-not-so-excellent-adventure/190268|title=Ryan and Sean's Not So Excellent Adventure|publisher=zap2it.com|accessdate=November 15, 2009}} It was shown in sold out theaters in [[Hawaii]] and [[California]].{{cite web|author=Associated Press |url=http://www.dailyherald.com/story/?id=249477 |title=YouTube was very good to this pair |publisher=Daily Herald |accessdate=September 19, 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090704190532/http://www.dailyherald.com/story/?id=249477 |archivedate=July 4, 2009 }} The DVD was released on July 14, 2009, in the United States.{{cite web|url=https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00208EXN0|title=Ryan and Sean's Not So Excellent Adventure (2008)|publisher=[[Amazon.com]]|accessdate=November 15, 2009}} ''Ryan and Sean's Not So Excellent Adventure'' is about a down on his luck movie producer, played by [[Michael Buckley (Internet celebrity)|Michael Buckley]], who is seeking out famous [[celebrities]] in order to make a hit movie in 30 days or risk being fired. He chooses Higa and Fujiyoshi after discovering the popularity of their YouTube videos. He invites them to [[Hollywood]] to make a movie. They accept the offer, and run into some amusing situations on the way.{{cite web|url=http://www.infoplease.com/movies/ryan-and-seans-not-so-excellent-adventure/68012|title=Ryan and Sean's Not So Excellent Adventure|publisher=infoplease.com|accessdate=November 15, 2009|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090910072433/http://www.infoplease.com/movies/ryan-and-seans-not-so-excellent-adventure/68012|archivedate=September 10, 2009|df=}} ''Ninja Melk'', a 26-minute short film about ninjas, was released in August 2009. The plot revolves around a ninja master named Master Ching Ching sending his student Lapchung (played by Bryson Murata) to find a replacement, finding Higa and Fujiyoshi to catch the evil Bokchoy (played by Tim Enos) and his henchwoman, Gina (played by Tarynn Nago).{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uIz3cb_igD4|title=Ninja Melk|last=Higa|first=Ryan|author2=Fujiyoshi, Sean |date=August 24, 2009|work=Video|publisher=[[YouTube]]|accessdate=November 29, 2009}} An independent 35 minute film he created with [[Wong Fu Productions]] called ''[[Agents of Secret Stuff]]'' was uploaded on the nigahiga channel on November 24, 2010. It features some other popular YouTube users as well as actors such as [[Aki Aleong]]. ''Agents of Secret Stuff'' is about a teenage A.S.S. ('''A'''gent of '''S'''ecret '''S'''tuff) (Higa) who is sent undercover to a high school to protect one of the students, a girl named Taylor ([[Arden Cho]]) from the A.S.S.'s enemy, the S.I.N.S. ('''S'''ociety '''I'''nvolving '''N'''ot-So-Good '''S'''tuff). It included guest appearances from Ian and Anthony of [[Smosh]], [[Dominic Sandoval|D-Trix]], [[KassemG]] and Hiimrawn. Higa has also guest starred on an episode of ''[[Supah Ninjas]]'', playing DJ Elephant Head, a master plotter who uses his hypnotizing electronic music to make people fall asleep to commit robberies. He appeared in the 2016 horror film ''Tell Me How I Die''.{{cite web |title=Ryan Higa |url=https://www.rottentomatoes.com/celebrity/1197697-ryan_higa |website=www.rottentomatoes.com |accessdate=9 June 2018 |language=en}} == Discography == === Single === {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! scope="col"| Title ! scope="col"| Year ! scope="col"| Album |- ! scope="row"| "Ignored"
(featuring David Choi) | 2015 | {{N/A|Non-album single}} |- |- ! scope="row"| "Millennial Love"
(featuring Kina Grannis) | 2017 | {{N/A|Non-album single}} |- |} == References == {{Reflist|2}} == External links == {{Commons category}} * [https://www.nigahiga.net/ Nigahiga] Channel Website * {{YouTube|user=nigahiga|nigahiga}} * {{IMDb name|3090514|Ryan Higa}} * {{IMDb title|1270113|Ryan and Sean's Not So Excellent Adventure}} {{authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Higa, Ryan}} [[Category:1990 births]] [[Category:American male actors of Japanese descent]] [[Category:American male actors]] [[Category:American male judoka]] [[Category:American people of Japanese descent]] [[Category:American people of Okinawan descent]] [[Category:American YouTubers]] [[Category:Comedy YouTubers]] [[Category:Dance Showdown judges]] [[Category:Internet Icon judges]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Hilo, Hawaii]] [[Category:University of Nevada, Las Vegas alumni]] [[Category:YouTube Diamond Play Button recipients]] [[Category:Male YouTubers]] [[Category:People with attention deficit hyperactivity disorder]]
